Authors: Esther Quintero, Alejandro Espinosa de los Monteros
Title:
Microanatomy and evolution of the nanostructures responsible
for the iridescent coloration in the Trogoniformes (Clase: Aves)
Keywords:
Trogoniformes, coloration, iridescence, character
evolution, iridescence production, transmission electron microscopy
Abstract:
One of the most outstanding features of the order
Trogoniformes is the presence of iridescence, which is widely
distributed throughout the group, except for the species of the Asian
genus Harpactes. Previous studies indicated that the
iridescence-producing nanostructures varied in form and array throughout
the order. Thus, in this study, our aim was to reconstruct the
evolutionary history of these iridescence-producing nanostructures
within this group in a phylogenetic context. Our results show that there
are some clear tendencies in the evolution of these nanostructures
throughout the order.
